Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: large, open kitchen

The kitchen is long and broad with high, smoke-blackened ceilings. Heavy wooden doors lead north to the dining area and south to a side yard; an open archway in the middle of the west wall leads to the larder. A wide, glazed window is set high in the east wall, and another high on the south wall; a wide, shallow fireplace is set just east of the middle of the north wall. A massive preparation table dominates the center of the room.
The dark kitchen has doors lead north and south, an open archway leads west. A high window is set in the east wall, and another in the south wall; a fireplace is set in the north wall.

The dimly-lit kitchen has heavy wooden doors leading north to the dining area and south to a side yard; an open archway in the middle of the west wall leads to the larder. A wide, glazed window is set high in the east wall, and another high in the south wall; a fireplace is set near the middle of the north wall. A great wooden table is in the center of the room.
A large, open kitchen.

From the kitchen, doors lead north to the dining area and south to the back yard; an open archway in the west wall leads to the larder. Windows are set high in the east and south walls, and a fireplace is set near the middle of the north wall. A massive preparation table dominates the center of the room.
This dark room has exits to the north, south and west and there are two windows. There is a fireplace set into the north wall.

From the dimly-lit kitchen, doors lead north and south, an open archway leads west. Windows are set high in the east and south walls, and a fireplace is set into the north wall. A great wooden table is in the center of the room.
http://www.skotos.net/TavernGame/maps/Kitchen.jpg
the northern door
A heavy wooden door is set near the western end of the northern wall; it leads to the dining room. A simple latch and lock are fitted to the door.
A door seems to exist in the northern wall.
A door is set near the western end of the northern wall of this dim room. A latch and lock are fitted to the door.
the southern door
A heavy wooden door is set near the middle of the southern wall; it leads to a side yard. A simple latch and lock are fitted to the door.
A door seems to exist in the southern wall.
A heavy wooden door is set near the middle of the southern wall of this dim room. A simple latch and lock are fitted to the door.
the western archway
An archway, in the middle of the western wall, leads out of the kitchen into the larder.
An archway seems to be set in the western wall.
An archway set in the western wall leads to another room.
NEW detail
storage baskets
Sturdy storage baskets containing utensils of various shapes and sizes and different sized pots and pans as well as charred baking baskets sit tidily on the shelves.
Sturdy storage baskets containing utensils of various shapes and sizes and different sized pots and pans as well as charred baking baskets sit tidily on the shelves.
the chimney
The fieldstone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the northern wall to the ceiling. There is no mantel or shelf on the chimney.
The stone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the northern wall.
The stone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the northern wall to the ceiling.
tall butter churn
A serviceable, well used butter churn with a long smooth handle and a slatted, barrel base sits in the southwest corner of the room.
You can just make out the shape of a butter churn in the southwest corner of the room.
A serviceable, well used butter churn with a long smooth handle and a slatted, barrel base sits in the southwest corner of the room.
A tall, wooden butter churn rests in the southwest corner of the room.
A tall, wooden butter churn rests in the southwest corner of the room.
You see a tall narrow shape in the southwest corner of the room.
a butter churn sits in the southwest corner of the room.
the fire
A cheerful fire is burning on a few logs within the hearth.
A cheerful fire is barely burning on a few logs within the hearth.
A cheerful fire is burning dimly on a few logs within the hearth.
the fireplace

Set against the middle of the northern wall is a fieldstone fireplace. The arched hearth opening contains a crackling fire. A heavy iron hook extends from the western wall of the fireplace to the center of the fire.
Set against the northern wall is a stone fireplace. The hearth contains a barely-alive fire. There seems to be a hook of some sort.
Set against the northern wall is a fireplace, in which a fire is dimly burning. A heavy iron hook extends from the western wall of the fireplace to the center of the fire.
various hanging herbs
a heavy iron hook
Two sturdy iron bars extend from the western wall of the hearth to join and support a large, heavy, charred iron hook from which can be hung various pots and cookware.
A heavy, iron hook protrudes from the western side of the fireplace and over the center of the fire.
NEW detail
two small paintings

Hanging inobtrusively at the northern end of the western wall are two small oil paintings in gilded frames, the first of three small foxes playing together in front of a cheerful fire and the other of a mother fox holding her kit close in a large wooden rocking chair.
Two small oil paintings of three young foxes playing with toys near a cheerful fire and a mother fox gently rocking her kit hang on the north end of the western wall.
storage shelves
Wide, storage shelves, mounted on the western wall near the archway, are laden with baskets of utensils of every shape and size, pots and pans and baking baskets.
You see shelving near the western archway.
Storage shelves, mounted on the western wall near the archway, are laden with baskets of utensils of every shape and size, pots, pans and baking baskets.
massive wooden preparation table

A massive, wooden preparation table is in the center of the room, taking up most of the space. The table has seen heavy use and has been worn smooth from frequent scrubbing. Multiple fox tails have been carved into each of the four legs.
A massive wooden preparation table.
A heavy, wooden preparation table sits in the center of the room.
long, narrow dressing table

A long, narrow wooden dressing table is in the southeast corner of the room. It seems that this is where the prepared food is dressed and garnished before they are brought to the customers, for it is less worn than the other tables.
A long, narrow wooden dressing table is in the southeast corner of the room.
the eastern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about 15 feet high; a wide, glazed window is set high in the wall.

The half-timbered eastern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster. A window seems to be set high in it.

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a wide, glazed window set high in this wall.

The close-studded, half-timbered eastern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square - not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. A wide, glazed window is set high in this wall.
The eastern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.

The half-timbered eastern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. A window is set high in the wall.
the northern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high. A heavy wooden door is set in this wall, near the western end; a fireplace is set just east of the middle of the wall.

The half-timbered northern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster. There seems to be a door and a fireplace set in the wall.

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a heavy wooden door set near the western end, and a fireplace near the middle of the wall.

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. A door is set near the western end of the wall, and a fireplace is set near the middle.
The northern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.

The half-timbered northern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a door and a fireplace set in the wall.
the southern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; a rectangular wooden door is set in the middle of the wall, and a wide, glazed window is set above the door.
The half-timbered southern wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster.

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a wooden door set in the middle of the wall, and a wide window set above the door.

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a door set in the middle of the wall, and a wide window above the door.
The southern side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster.

The half-timbered southern wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. There is a door and a window set in the wall.
the western wall

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all somewhat less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; an open archway is set in the middle of the wall.
The half-timbered western wall of this dark room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough plaster. There is an archway in the wall.

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall of this dim room is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. An open archway is set in the wall.

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall is constructed of oak posts and diagonal braces, somewhat less than perfectly flat and square -- not all are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. An open archway is set in the wall.
The western side of this dark room seems to be a wall, built of wood and plaster. There seems to be an open archway in the wall.

The half-timbered western wall of this dim room is constructed of wooden posts and diagonal braces. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, white plaster. An open archway is built into the wall.
the front window

A wide, glazed casement window is set high in the eastern wall. It provides a view, through its small, blurry glass panes, of the front yard and the sky. Various herbs hang in bundles along a string fashioned across the window.
A wide, glazed casement window is set high in the eastern wall. It provides a view of the sky.
A wide, glazed casement window is set high in the middle of the eastern wall. Herbs hang in the window. It provides a view, through its small, glass panes, of the sky.
the side window

A wide, glazed casement window is set high in the western end of the southern wall. Various herbs hang in bundles along a string fashioned across the window. It provides a view, through its small, glass panes, of the sky.
A wide glazed casement window is set high in the southern wall. It provides a view of the sky.
A wide, glazed casement window is set high in the western half of the southern wall. Herbs are hanging in the window. It provides a view, through its small, glass panes, of the sky.
